title: The Atlantic’s Elizabeth Bruenig on her “hypothetical,” heavily reported measles essay
description: “The birthday-party invitation said ‘siblings welcome,’ which means you can bring your 11-month-old son while your husband is out of town,” Elizabeth Bruenig’s piece begins. “This is how a child dies of measles” was published by The Atlantic on Thursday afternoon and is currently the most popular story on site. It’s written in the second...
